nodes.bodyText: Real nit-picky, but maybe Registry the image belongs to? At first glance I read Registry image as noun phrase
You don't need to create an intermediate Set; you can just add the image directly by calling tag.getImages().add(<image>).
Same, you don't need intermediate set
Following up on my previous comments, if this always returns a max of one Image (?), then the method should return an Optional and not a Set.

Should this just use an Enum?
See Organization.status for an example.
The enum would seem to just be io.dockstore.common.Registry

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6874,6 +6874,16 @@ definitions:
         type: "string"
         position: 4
         description: "Docker ID of the image"
+      imageRegistry:
+        type: "string"
+        position: 5
+        description: "Registry the image belongs to"
+        enum:
+        - "QUAY_IO"

nodes.bodyText:
Comment above seems to be out-of-date now.
I guess the bigger issue is I don't understand how/if this deals with paging and the identified problem that we may need to page through a large number of tags in order to get images.
yeah, that is in another ticket https://ucsc-cgl.atlassian.net/browse/DOCK-1211
